ander were to say, “There’s nothing
we can do for you. We cannot choose between your life and his, we cannot
be the ones to decide who is to live, we cannot intervene.” But it cannot be
concluded that you too can do nothing, that you cannot attack it to save
your life. However innocent the child may be, you do not have to wait pas-
sively while it crushes you to death. Perhaps a pregnant woman is vaguely
felt to have the status of house, to which we don’t allow the right of self-
defense. But if
